executiveSummary.problemStatement: Individuals and small teams struggle to organize and track their tasks effectively, often relying on scattered notes, complex project management tools, or memory alone. This leads to missed deadlines, forgotten tasks, and decreased productivity due to lack of a simple, focused task management solution.
executiveSummary.targetUsers: Individual professionals, freelancers, students, and small team members who need a straightforward way to create, organize, and track personal or shared tasks without the complexity of enterprise project management tools.
executiveSummary.valueProposition: A clean, intuitive task tracker that focuses on simplicity and ease of use, allowing users to quickly capture, organize, and complete tasks without overwhelming features or steep learning curves.
executiveSummary.missionStatement: To provide the simplest yet effective way for individuals and small teams to stay organized and productive through focused task management.

mvpValidationGoals.description: Validate user adoption and engagement with core task management features
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 50+ active users creating at least 5 tasks per week within first month

mvpValidationGoals.description: Prove the platform can handle basic CRUD operations reliably
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 99% uptime with sub-2 second response times for task operations

mvpValidationGoals.description: Confirm users find value in the simplicity approach
mvpValidationGoals.successIndicator: 70% user retention rate after 2 weeks and average session duration > 5 minutes

explicitNonGoals: Advanced project management features like Gantt charts or resource allocation
Team collaboration features beyond basic task sharing
Integration with external tools or APIs
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create, read, update, and delete tasks successfully
Tasks can be organized into categories and marked as complete
User authentication and data persistence work reliably
Interface is responsive and works on desktop and tablet browsers
Application loads within 3 seconds on standard internet connections

features.name: Task Creation and Management
features.description: Users can create new tasks with titles, descriptions, and due dates. Tasks can be edited at any time and deleted when no longer needed. This core functionality provides the foundation for all task tracking activities and ensures users can capture and modify their work items efficiently.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to create and manage tasks with relevant details so that I can keep track of what needs to be done

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am on the main dashboard
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click 'Add Task' and enter task details
acceptanceCriteria.then: a new task is created and displayed in my task list

acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the edit button and modify details
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is updated with new information

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have a task I no longer need
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the delete button and confirm
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is permanently removed from my list

edgeCases: Creating tasks with empty titles should show validation error
Editing tasks while offline should queue changes for sync
Deleting tasks should require confirmation to prevent accidents

features.name: Task Status Management
features.description: Users can mark tasks as complete or incomplete with a simple checkbox interface. Completed tasks remain visible but are visually distinguished from active tasks. This feature provides the satisfying experience of checking off completed work while maintaining visibility of accomplishments.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to mark tasks as complete so that I can track my progress and feel accomplished

acceptanceCriteria.when: I click the checkbox next to it
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is marked as complete with visual indication
completed and active tasks are visually distinct

edgeCases: Rapid clicking on checkboxes should not create duplicate state changes
Status changes should persist immediately without requiring save action
Completed tasks with past due dates should not show overdue warnings

features.name: Task Organization with Categories
features.description: Users can create custom categories (like 'Work', 'Personal', 'Urgent') and assign tasks to these categories. Categories help organize tasks by type, priority, or project, making it easier to focus on specific areas of work. Users can filter their task view by category to reduce cognitive load.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to organize my tasks into categories so that I can focus on specific types of work and maintain better organization

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am creating or editing a task
acceptanceCriteria.when: I select a category from the dropdown
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is assigned to that category

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am on the main dashboard
acceptanceCriteria.when: I click on a category filter
acceptanceCriteria.then: only tasks from that category are displayed

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to create a new category
acceptanceCriteria.when: I enter a new category name
acceptanceCriteria.then: it becomes available for task assignment

edgeCases: Tasks without assigned categories should appear in a default 'Uncategorized' view
Deleting a category should prompt user to reassign or move tasks to uncategorized
Category names should be unique and have character limits

features.name: Due Date Tracking
features.description: Users can assign optional due dates to tasks and receive visual indicators for upcoming and overdue items. The interface highlights tasks approaching their due dates and clearly marks overdue tasks to help users prioritize their work effectively and meet deadlines.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to set due dates for tasks so that I can prioritize urgent work and avoid missing deadlines

acceptanceCriteria.given: I am creating or editing a task
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task displays the due date prominently

acceptanceCriteria.given: I have tasks with various due dates
acceptanceCriteria.then: tasks are visually distinguished by due date status (upcoming, overdue, no date)

acceptanceCriteria.when: the current date passes the due date
acceptanceCriteria.then: the task is clearly marked as overdue with appropriate styling

edgeCases: Due dates in the past should be allowed but marked as overdue immediately
Tasks completed after their due date should not show overdue status
Timezone handling should use user's local timezone for due date calculations

features.name: User Authentication and Data Persistence
features.description: Users can create accounts, log in securely, and have their tasks saved permanently to the cloud. This ensures tasks are never lost and can be accessed from any device. The authentication system protects user data while providing a seamless experience across sessions.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to create an account and log in so that my tasks are saved securely and accessible from anywhere

acceptanceCriteria.when: I register with email and password
acceptanceCriteria.then: an account is created and I am logged in automatically
I am logged in and see my saved tasks

acceptanceCriteria.given: I create tasks while logged in
acceptanceCriteria.when: I log out and back in
acceptanceCriteria.then: all my tasks are still available

edgeCases: Invalid login attempts should show appropriate error messages
Password reset functionality should be available via email
Session timeout should gracefully redirect to login without data loss

features.name: Search and Filter Functionality
features.description: Users can search for tasks by title or description text and apply filters to show only active tasks, completed tasks, or tasks from specific categories. This helps users quickly find specific tasks in larger lists and focus on relevant subsets of their work.
features.userStory: As a user, I want to search and filter my tasks so that I can quickly find specific items in large task lists

acceptanceCriteria.when: I type in the search box
acceptanceCriteria.then: tasks matching the search term are displayed in real-time

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to see only active tasks
acceptanceCriteria.then: completed tasks are hidden from view

acceptanceCriteria.given: I want to combine search and filters
acceptanceCriteria.when: I search within a filtered view
acceptanceCriteria.then: results show only items matching both criteria

edgeCases: Empty search results should show helpful message
Search should be case-insensitive and handle partial matches
Clearing search should restore the previous filtered view

coreFeatures.mvpScope: The MVP will focus on core task management capabilities including creating, editing, and deleting tasks with basic status tracking (complete/incomplete). Users will have secure authentication and persistent data storage. Essential organization features like categories and due dates will be included to provide meaningful task prioritization. Search and advanced filtering will be deferred to post-MVP releases to maintain simplicity and faster time-to-market.

roles.name: Individual User
roles.description: Primary user who creates and manages their personal tasks
permissions: Create, read, update, and delete their own tasks
Search and filter their task list
Mark tasks as complete or incomplete

keyFlows: New user registration → account creation → first task creation → basic task management
Daily workflow: login → review task list → create new tasks → update existing tasks → mark completed items → logout
Task organization: create categories → assign tasks to categories → filter by category → manage within focused view

requirements: Web-based application accessible via modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Responsive design supporting desktop (1024px+) and tablet (768px+) screen sizes
RESTful API architecture with JSON data exchange
Secure user authentication with encrypted password storage
Database capable of handling user accounts and task data with referential integrity
HTTPS encryption for all data transmission
Page load times under 3 seconds on standard broadband connections

launchRequirements: All must-have features (F001, F002, F005) fully implemented and tested
User authentication and data security measures in place
Basic error handling and user feedback mechanisms working
Responsive design tested on target devices and browsers
Database backup and recovery procedures established
Basic user documentation or onboarding flow available
launchBlockers: Critical security vulnerabilities in authentication or data handling
Data loss or corruption issues in task storage
Application crashes or becomes unusable on target browsers
User registration or login functionality failure
Complete inability to create, edit, or delete tasks
Performance issues causing page load times over 10 seconds
